name: Nan Duan
headline: Supercell Shanghai Studio Lead
creator: FALSE
school_1: University of California, Berkeley, Haas School of Business
bio:
Since 2019, I've been working at Supercell Shanghai, helping to build up the game studio as well participating in several R&D projects. This is the first Supercell dev studio outside Finland, which makes it an extra-exciting challenge.

From 2011-2019, I worked at Riot Games across the US and Asia. I started League of Legends: Wild Rift with two other Rioters in 2017. Previously, I spent 2.5 years in Hong Kong to help Riot build up its China presence, and shipped a strategic PC cafe feature to Chinese players. Earlier, I was based in Santa Monica and helped launch League of Legends in Taiwan and a few other Asian markets.

Please check out my technology blog (bayjinger.com) to see my thoughts on various games industry and broader tech sector topics.

I hold an MBA from the Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley. I did my 2010 summer internship at VMware Inc., in the Strategy & Corporate Development Team. My internship experience involves strategy research on cloud computing and Software-as-a-Service.

Prior to Haas, I was a management consultant at the Monitor Group, with project experience in China, India, Indonesia and the Philippines. My work focused on corporate and marketing strategy in consumer goods, telecoms, IT and chemicals industries, as well as strategic due diligence for private equity.

name: Derek Chan
headline: Marketing Leader at Supercell (ex-Google / EA / Ubisoft / Zynga) ✌️
creator: FALSE
school_1: Northwestern University - Kellogg School of Management
school_2: University of California, Berkeley, Haas School of Business
bio:
Senior marketing executive with over two decades of results in some of the world’s top gaming and technology companies.

I’m a versatile and structured thinker who loves to interrogate and expose the things that make people tick. Then I distill and apply that in brand and marketing strategies that cut through the noise to earn consensus and commitment. I thrill in partnering with the best people and teams to deliver never-been-done creative campaigns that provoke a grin (or a shiver). Things that work hard, and things with a twist. 

I’ve worked on global-scale mobile & console video games, digital content platforms, and consumer internet products. I’ve launched and grew some of the biggest and most beloved gaming franchises in the world, and helped hundreds of millions of people fall in love with them. I've helped create one of the world’s biggest esports competitions, and I led an elite in-house creative agency.

And yet, the thing that I’m most proud of is how I work with other people and how I make them feel. I build, lead and develop teams from a service mindset: with honest and humble empathy, collaboration, and recognition of the humanity in every person. Whether with teammates or partners, my approach is direct, without pretense or ego.

name: Aditi Bose
headline: Gaming Product Veteran | Supercell | ex Zynga | ex Product Madness
creator: FALSE
bio:
Product Manager with over a decade of experience in casual gaming (online & mobile). 

I have had end-to-end involvement with several games starting with analytics (data, gameplay, competitors), managed cross functional teams to incorporate insights & finally communicating directly with the players through targeting tools.

name: Curtis Lelash
headline: Producer & Creative Executive | Former Netflix, Cartoon Network, and Dreamworks Animation
creator: FALSE
bio:
Curtis Lelash is an award-winning TV Producer and Creative Executive with over twenty years of experience serving leading entertainment and media brands. As the Director of Kids & Family at Netflix, Lelash spearheaded the development and production of a diverse slate of animated series for kids, young adults, and family audiences. 

Prior to his role at Netflix, Lelash served as the Senior Vice President of Original Series at Cartoon Network. He joined the company in 2005, and quickly rose to the rank of VP, which deemed him responsible for the development and ongoing supervision of the network’s animated comedy series, including Emmy winners ADVENTURE TIME, REGULAR SHOW, OVER THE GARDEN WALL and STEVEN UNIVERSE. Before CN, Lelash gained development experience on theatrical projects at DreamWorks Animation and Storyopolis.

With a passion for steering imaginative projects, leading creative teams, and collaborating with storytellers and showrunners at all levels, Lelash’s career achievements include two Peabody Awards, four Primetime Emmys, and twenty Primetime Emmy nominations.

*I do not accept or respond to pitches via LinkedIn.*

name: Antti Takala
headline: Programmer at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
I have programmed for different platforms with various languages since I was a kid, mostly interested in real-time graphics programming.

I'm familiar with various mobile platforms such as Android, iOS, Symbian, Maemo, MeeGo, Windows Mobile and various different embedded Linux environments. 2D and 3D graphics programming in SDL, DirectX, OpenGL, OpenGL ES 1.x, OpenGL ES 2.0 and WebGL.

Specialties: Real-time graphics programming, game programming, tool and utility programming, embedded Linux, microcontrollers, mobile devices and operating systems.

Limited Partner in several VC funds.

name: Yasin Hatiboğlu
headline: Data Analyst at Supercell
creator: TRUE
school_1: WU (Vienna University of Economics and Business)
bio:
Product manager and data analyst.

Keywords: Research for growth opportunities, data analysis, AB testing
Tech: R, SQL, Tableau

🕹️ 6+ years experience in the gaming industry
🎓 M.Sc. in Quantitative Finance at Vienna University of Economics
🎓 B.Sc. in Econometrics at Gazi University

I enjoy deep-diving into data, deriving actionable insights, and telling a story about them in an easily understandable and actionable manner.

Specialties:
- Identifying growth opportunities 
- Coming up with data-informed game design ideas
- AB test design, monitoring and conclusion 
- Player behavior insights through deep-dive analyses

name: Vladislav P.
headline: "Hey I know you from that Supercell video"
creator: TRUE
bio:
12+ years of experience working on Community, Content Marketing, Player Engagement and making video games long-term commitments with the people that love making and playing them.

I focus on creating genuine love for the games that we make by projecting our passion onto players, and in return earning their passion back, resulting in a healthy and enjoyable long-term relationship between the players and the development teams.

The main projects that I worked on in the past were DUST 514, PUBG MOBILE, and now Clash Mini and Clash Heroes.

name: Stephan Demirdjian
headline: Spark Lead at Supercell
creator: FALSE
school_1: WU (Vienna University of Economics and Business)
school_2: University of Miami Herbert Business School
bio:
With years of dedicated service in the games industry, notably on the acclaimed mobile game Hay Day, I have had the enriching experience of building and advancing both the game and its team. My journey has evolved to leading Supercell's initiatives in forming new, high-performing game development teams, with a profound passion for the human team performance element at the heart of these ventures. My path has not been without its hurdles; I've lead the development of two new game teams which, despite our best efforts, were ultimately killed due to various challenges. These experiences have been pivotal, teaching me invaluable lessons regarding the complexities that are required to build small high performing teams.

I took all these lessons to spearhead Supercell's “Team Lab” project, where we established a more formalized approach in how to build our next high performing new game teams, here at Supercell. After 6 months of rigorous testing of different team compositions that were built in Team Lab, we brought the project to a conclusion, by having 2 teams ready to go and pass our team greenlight procedure.

With these positive results at hand, Supercell is now embarking on "Spark" (= the second round of Team Lab). This time around we are welcoming strong entrepreneurial minded external developers as well. This applies to individuals, incomplete teams but also complete ones. 

I’d be very happy to elaborate further and discuss how you could take part in Spark. You can reach me via stephan@supercell.com

headline: Product Support @Supercell - HayDay
creator: FALSE
school_2: Universidad de San Carlos de Guatemala
bio:
Enthusiastic Support professional with 15 years of industry know-how, collaborating with customers across LACAR, EMEA, and the U.S. For the past three years, I've been honing my skills specifically in support for the gaming industry, aligning perfectly with my personal interests and passions! My journey includes rocking roles in Operations, Quality and Training management, Client Relationships, Customer Success, Hiring, Language Training, and Project Implementation.

Over the years, I've soaked up insights from diverse backgrounds, tackling varied challenges and environments. This journey has shaped me into a well-rounded leader who excels at performance management. I'm all about implementing creative solutions, restructuring processes, and cultivating top-notch teams to achieve exceptional results. Let's level up together!

name: Maurice Kroes
headline: Producer @ Brawl Stars
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm a leader who wants to get the best out of people every single day. I want to enable them to produce great products as a team and to grow as individuals. I learned that a strong direction and vision is key for creating interesting challenges for talented individuals to solve. Make it visible, keep it simple, trust people to do the right thing. 

I'll question the status quo, to drive improvement. But I'll also stay humble and respect others' decisions. Failures are opportunities to learn and grow. I always strive to be open, transparent and constructive. I love building games and most of all building talented teams.

Worked as Executive Director, Producer, QA, Product Management, Product Owner & Scrum Master and have a background in art, design and development.

----

When sending an invite, do note why you want to connect. Thanks!

name: Sean Cornejo
headline: Brand Development at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
I’m passionate about creating and nurturing communities and experiences that bring people together in innovative, fun, and meaningful ways.

From building deep 1:1 connections, to leading content and strategy for a game with millions of players, to orchestrating high-energy, competitive events, and spearheading an award-winning brand campaign that captured a decade of CLASH community spirit -- my experience spans a diverse range of projects.

Now, in my current role, I apply these insights to shape IP direction, refine brand strategies, craft the perfect tone, and influence game features from early development through to global launch.

name: Sara Jansson Bach
headline: Chief Live Games Officer
creator: FALSE
bio:
From Super Mario on my first console, to late nights playing strategy games as a teenager and programming my own games at university, I've always loved playing and later making games. 

With 16 years in the games industry I have worked on many different types of games ranging from online multiplayer games such as Battlefield to F2P mobile games such as Candy Crush. 

I've headed up game teams and organisations of various sizes and complexity. I thrive where creative meets product and always strive to build games and products that players will love in ways that works for the business.

name: Edmond Maillard
headline: Engine Programmer
creator: FALSE
bio:
Seasoned software architect with over a decade of experience developing for embedded devices across various domains, including mobiles phones, set top boxes, Smart TVs, automotive IC and IVI systems, etc. Highly flexible, I am experienced with various languages languages, frameworks and platforms, with a focus on native C and C++ development.

Demonstrated success in leading diverse teams and managing end-to-end development of innovative products and technologies. Proficient in rendering engines, backend service architecture, UI frameworks, tooling, functional safety and system optimizations for multiple platforms. Adept at navigating complex, fast-paced environments and driving projects from concept to completion, with a strong track record of delivering high-quality software solutions for industry leaders like Alibaba.

Examples of recent achievements:
- Successfully pivoted and led the Alibaba AliOS rendering team, developing a native UI framework that has been widely adopted across various customer-facing applications, including Taobao and Banma automotive solutions.
The new framework resulted in significant improvements in runtime performance, memory usage, and loading times, while enhancing feature support for diverse front-end UI frameworks.

- Conducted in-depth research and spearheaded the implementation of innovative Cloud Native features on the Alibaba Cloud Gaming platform, positioning the company at the forefront of cloud gaming technology.

- Directed a skilled team in the creation and maintenance of a cutting-edge application development engine, providing bespoke 3D-accelerated UI solutions for key manufacturing partners of Alibaba such as Sharp, Philips, TCL, etc...

- As the CTO of Gaya3D, strategically steered the company's technology focus from a game engine to an application engine for embedded devices, resulting in the successful acquisition by industry giant Alibaba, thereby expanding the company's reach and impact in the technology sector.

name: Annabell Bori César
headline: Global Product Marketing | Supercell | Brawl Stars | MBA based in Finland
creator: TRUE
current_position: Global Senior Product Marketing Manager, Brawl Stars
bio:
I’ll skip the obvious and will tell you the unique. My laughter might be the most explosive you’ll ever hear. I am honest and don’t waste my time doing things I don’t enjoy. Loved ones are everything. D&I is my passion and video games are my life.

I am a strategic marketer with experience building and leading diverse teams covering: go-to-market strategy, brand, influencer, esports, PR, Social Media, partnerships and Product Marketing. I've had a go at ecommerce, payment methods, and digital marketing. I proudly identify as a nerd, digital since 2009 (That's 15 years, folks!) with a profound calling to build a more loving, diverse and inclusive world. 

I have a personal goal of impacting at least one person a year in a life-changing way. I believe helping others grow is the best to grow, and I couldn't be more grateful for the opportunity to give back.

During my free time, I am a gamer, a cook, a writer, and a human seeking to be better than yesterday. Besides Helsinki, I have lived in Mexico City, Shanghai, Paris, Florence, Venice, Valencia, San Sebastián and New York.

name: Markus Pasula
headline: Supercell
creator: FALSE
school_2: Further Education for Producers and Leads of the Finnish Game Industry, ARTO, Helsinki
bio:
20 years in mobile game development and leadership

Key experience roles:
- Game Lead / Head of Studio
- CEO
- CTO / Tech guru, awesome programmer too
- Deep understanding of analytics, liveops, performance marketing (UA), F2P mechanics, monetisation, consumer products, scalable services, game design, ux design, creative team leadership, fundraising, strategy, business development, market research, testing, rapid prototyping, MVP-aproach, lean organisations, mobile platforms, product management, PR, pitching, programming, realtime graphics and technical scuba diving

In 2011 Markus founded Grand Cru together with five other game industry veterans. He worked as CEO for 7 years, during which I doubled as game lead for 2 games, build a great team and company culture, raised over 13M€ in funding, developed tens of prototypes and soft launched 5 games, of which 2 were with promising metrics and worked a lot with analytics and marketing. Battlejack became the focus of the company and has made millions in revenue.

Previously Markus worked at Mr.Goodliving/RealNetworks in various roles, including Head of Studio, Technology and Customer Operations. Markus and the technologies developed by his team played a key role when RealNetworks acquired Mr.Goodliving in 2005. During Markus' time at Mr.Goodliving, the company gained a position among the top five mobile game publishers worldwide with 100+ games, each supporting 4000+ mobile devices and several of them reaching top positions in the App Store.

Back in the 1990's Markus was one of the pioneers in the Finnish Demoscene. Later, in the early 2000's he developed his own VJ-system and performed live visuals for many international top artists at several electronic music festivals.

name: Juho Ojala
headline: Senior Server Engineer at Supercell
creator: FALSE

name: Essi Marjamäki
headline: Communications and Change Management | Bridging Business Strategy and Communications
creator: FALSE
school_1: CEMS - The Global Alliance in Management Education
bio:
Change management certified communications and marketing professional and enthusiast with a positive and curious outlook on life. Experienced in communications and change management, business development, product and comms strategy & marketing, driving results by leveraging and leading cross-functional virtual teams, a challenge-seeker bridging business and communications.

I've managed projects ranging from developing and executing business and marketing communications strategies and organizing events to up to 2000 attendees to helping teams to get from chaos to clarity. Currently on a mission to bring joy to people: the players of our games and the makers of them by fostering a flow of communication inside and out.

Working in teams with cross-cultural capacity is what I enjoy, live and breathe every day. People, communications, and learning get me excited every day.

name: Rick Crane
headline: Creator Program: Product Owner @ Supercell | Strategy Development
creator: TRUE
bio:
My aim is to gain experience and further knowledge within the mobile app industry in order to progress and ultimately start creating, designing and coding games as a career.

A highly motivated and energetic person with outstanding communication and team skills. 
Able to work on my own efficiently as well as being a great team player.
I have strong organisational skills and and push myself to resolve any hurdles that come in my way.

Loves being challenged and have the ability to work under extreme pressure. 
I consider myself to be a “people person” with an entrepreneur mindset.

name: Karoliina Korppoo
headline: Getting Stuff Done in games.
creator: FALSE
bio:
Design Lead on Cities: Skylines. TED speaker.

My passion is the end-user, what they want, what they expect and what they feel when using a product. I have over 16 years of experience in the games industry of various different positions, including art lead, lead producer and lead designer.

My best-known game design position has been working as the design lead for Cities: Skylines.

name: Manuel Langegger
headline: Growth Marketing at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
I love learning. I get excited when I find a new field I know little about. Industries and trends are changing so much that most of the things we thought to be true 5 years ago, no longer hold true, or yield diminishing returns. Not so long time ago, families would sit around a TV and watch content together. Digital advertising has since surpassed traditional media. Not so long time ago, gaming was not a lucrative career - millions of aspiring gamers have since proved these traditional views wrong. Not so long time ago, TikTok was this strange little App with teenage girls creating lip-sync videos. TikTok has since surpassed YouTube in engagement for some countries. How will our next 10 years look like? I get excited thinking about that! 

Being able to adapt in today's world is of major importance in order to stay competitive. I like to stick to the fundamentals and improvise, risk, try, fail and learn on top of that to constantly keep growing. Like nature itself - we either constantly grow or are eventually replaced by someone/ something that creates more value in our industry or even completely disrupts it. 

On a personal level, I also feel that as we learn to navigate new challenges, we should appreciate the process, as it is what adds spice to life. I am always very interested in connecting with other professionals and hear about your views.

Have an amazing day!

name: Jani Nurminen
headline: Leadership | Digital services | Computer graphics & game technology | Ex-entrepreneur
creator: FALSE
bio:
An ex-entrepreneur with more than two decades of experience in creating shiny real-time pixels, mobile applications and digital products around the globe (hundreds of millions end-users). Always looking for ways to push boundaries to make an impact on the surrounding world. By heart still a computer graphics, game and technology geeks.

Highlights:
- 10+ years of entrepreneurship and successful exit
- Impacted lives of hundreds of millions end-users (combined number of all projects I have participated)
- Developed real-time graphics / game technology / games more than dozen platforms (starting from C64)
- Worked with gaming giants like Supercell, Rovio, Microsoft and EA
- Game launch in Microsoft keynote event
- Most likely the first IOS developer in Finland
- Recognised R&D in field of real-time volumetric video decoding and rendering in consumer level mobile hardware
- After decades of software development, still eager to learn new thing

name: Sylvain Noblet
headline: Marketing Lead - Brawl Stars at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
Greetings and thank you for stopping by my profile. 

Tldr: I’m an hardcore gamer, mainly on PC who likes to build stuff and deliver awesome to communities of players. 

Deeply into games, I had the epiphany using my older brother's Amiga in the 90’s, which is a passion that only grown since then. I also had the opportunity to create my very first own video game studio Playrion, specialized in simulation / strategy games (sold to Paradox Interactive in 2020) and I’m planning to redo the experience at some point. 

I had worked on multiple projects and platforms, before joining Supercell in October 2023 for which I'm now the Marketing Lead for an exceptional title: Brawl Stars! 

Previously Head of Moba & Strategy games EMEA at Riot Games, I’ve learned what being players centric truly means while also leading a team of Product Leads covering our games League of Legends (PC), League of Legends: Wild Rift (Mobile), Teamfight Tactics (PC & Mobile), Legends of Runeterra (PC & Mobile), Arcane (tv show) and licensed titles through  our brand Riot Forge. 

I have been working for the last 10 years with awesome game developers, partners, first parties,  and multicultural teams on a daily basis and have a proven track record leading projects, developing 360° marketing campaigns and brand strategies for all-sizes titles and licences: 
 - Undisclosed titles
- League of Legends (PC)
 - League of Legends: Wild Rift (mobile)
 - Teamfight Tactics (Pc and mobile)
 - Legends of Runeterra (Pc and Mobile)
 - Super Spell Heroes (Mobile)
 - Zombie Gunship Survival (mobile)  
 - Olympus Rising (mobile)
 - Airlines-Manager 1 & 2 (browser and Mobile)

Favorite game genres & titles: 
- PC - Strategy / 4X (Total War & Civilization franchises, Crusader kings II & III) 
- MOBA (League of Legends
- Politic & Economic simulation (Suzerain, Real Politiks 2, Democracy, Yes your grace). 
- Mobile (brawl Stars,League of Legends: Wild Rift, The last day on earth, Fallout shelter, Sim City Build it, Hay day). 

Feel free to contact me if you need more information or references or simply to talk about games.

Cheers, 
S.

name: Pedro Alvim 🏳️‍🌈🎮
headline: Marketing Lead at Supercell X | Global |Creator Economy Specialist | Avatar Expert | Now at Supercell | Ex-Social Media Former Director at Magalu
creator: TRUE
school_2: ESPM Escola Superior de Propaganda e Marketing
bio:
In my previous experiente, as the Social Media and Creator Economy Director at Magalu, I lead a team of professionals who are responsible for the social media and influencer marketing strategy and execution across all platforms, reaching over 32 million followers and fans on social network platforms. Magalu is the largest retail company in Brazil on Social Media and one of the most innovative companies with the biggest virtual influencer globally, called Lu from Magalu. I have recently taken on the role of leading Supercell X's social media and reputation strategies for the stores and Id.

With more than 15 years of experience in digital, content, and social media, I have a passion for creating engaging and impactful branded content, understand de cultures, communities, the creator’s mindset on social platforms, and short videos campaigns, that drive innovation, business growth and customer loyalty. I have a postgraduate degree in Digital Influence, and I am a TEDx speaker, a Linkedin creator, and a mentor and teacher in this field. I have also won several awards, including a Golden Cannes Lions, for my work in social media and influencer marketing with Lu. Some of my achievements include making Magalu the top 1 retail brand on TikTok globally and establishing Magalu’s 3D model and activist, “Lu do Magalu”, as the most followed virtual influencer in the world. My mission is to become one of the most exponential leaders in shaping the future of branded content, influencer marketing, and social media industry globally.

name: Kasim Zorlu
headline: Growth Strategy and Activation at Supercell
creator: FALSE
current_position: Global Head of Media and Operations
bio:
Operator working from the trenches of marketing and growth. Mostly trading attention through multiple screens for growing audiences, revenues and profit. I build teams, teams of teams, capabilities and light processes customized based on lifecycle stage of a company, founder vision, culture and ambition…

Why Games?
Games give the highest power to consumers compared to any form of entertainment. I had a chance to join games industry at the time of major change with Facebook’s global expansion and introduction of iPhone. 

The way games businesses operate has changed completely in less than 10 years time from both an organizational and a business perspective, regardless of platform. We can think of constant bundling and unbundling of marketing and distribution channels, franchises and business models. 

It has been a great journey so far.

name: Jannica Routamo
headline: Sports Program, Event and Experience Leader, currently working at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio: As a former athlete I’ve grown up with a mindset of ‘Impossible is just an opinion’ which has made me love a challenge through which I can grow and innovate by using my driven, energetic, and curious personality. During my career I’ve continued to show that I am a highly creative, oragnised and passionate professional who has the proven ability to make a tremendous impact on the success of organisations in sports, event & broadcast, and hospitality/experience management roles. I have demonstrated that I possess the vision to see the “Big Picture” but also the smaller details that are critical to creating dynamic experiences that significantly impact businesses and leave lasting impressions. By asking questions, being flexible and adapting fast, I’ve problem solved issues of all scale and complexity ranging from strategic vision to creative direction. I am also a powerful leader who empower teams to excel by fostering a culture that promotes staff engagement, teamwork, creativity, and professional development as core components for achieving sustained excellence.

name: Anna Bouveng
headline: Marketing @ Supercell | Brand | Strategy | Leadership | Ex Netflix, Avalanche Studios, EA
creator: FALSE
bio:
With 15+ years of experience in shaping the entertainment landscape, I’ve launched standout products, crafted impactful brands, and guided teams to success. My journey spans global marketing, PR, events and project management across the gaming and SVOD industries.

I’m all about creativity, leadership, and results. I believe in building teams that are proactive, innovative, and self-motivated. Hitting KPIs, driving growth, and meeting deadlines are in my DNA, but I’m always pushing for what's next.

Off the clock, I’m an entertainment junkie - books, games, movies, music, series, you name it. Crossfit keeps me energized, the outdoors keeps me grounded, and my dogs keep me smiling.

name: Juhani Alvesalo
headline: Total Rewards Lead
creator: FALSE
bio:
I am an HR professional with extensive Human Resource experience especially in Compensation & Benefits and Business HR. I have worked over 15 years in various global business environments combining business strategy and goals with HR processes and people aspects. My way of working is by nature business driven, energetic, positive and proactive.

headline: Player Experience Manager at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio: Experienced player support/experience professional, with hands-on experience in setting up and managing support tools & operations for multiple game projects. name: Erol Tekkanat
headline: Brand Marketing Manager at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
Product marketing expert and video game fan working at Supercell.
Always aiming for measurable impact, building worlds and growing a community.

Worked 5+ years on live games (Clash Royale, Brawl Stars) with massive global player base, major brand history and constant introduction of new content for players. Proven success in running and growing highly engaging social channels with massive organic reach.

Experience in ASO, platform partnership, User Acquisition, influencer and community marketing.

name: Tommi Vikkula
headline: Data Engineer at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
IT expert with wide experience in leading software development teams, building and innovating on business-critical IT systems.

Appreciated for good communication skills, people-centrism and drive to achieve business goals. Has a wide technical expertise from software team leadership and architectural design to hands-on programming of software solutions and building innovative data solutions using machine learning and big data technologies.

Has worked with international organisations in a wide range of business sectors such as aviation, media, e-commerce, healthcare, logistics, forestry and energy.

Gains energy from mentoring younger professionals, helping others grow and being an active driver in business growth and organisation development.

name: Jon Howard
headline: PR/Comms @ Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
For over 16 years, I’ve thrived on telling the stories of great people, products and ideas.  
Since forever, I’ve been somewhat less keen on selling myself.  Here goes:

1) I’ve led the communications strategy within an array of different organisation types, including publicly listed entertainment companies, rapid growth start-ups and nonprofits. Along the way I’ve worked with action movie heroes to government ministers, large cap corporation CEOs to teenage social media stars.

2) When it comes to IP, I’ve meticulously built and led PR campaigns for numerous entertainment hall of famers, whether it’s enraged avians (Angry Birds), mushroom-loving plumbers (Super Mario), or the hero of Hyrule (The Legend of Zelda).

3) Most recently, I served as GM and ran the day to day operations for one of APAC's most awarded (agency performance and best culture) communications agencies.

4) I once took on a consultancy gig at UN Environment, where I was brought in to level up the reach/impact of its climate action work with both the video games and sport industries. 

5) I got my first gig in Communications & PR because of two great people who looked past my lack of experience at the time, apparently thinking I had the right passion and mindset to be a Press Officer. Will somehow pay you back one day, Tony and Louise.

6) I’ve a Masters Degree in Sport, Culture and Media. I based my 2008 final paper around how social media content creators would come to redefine journalism/media reporting. This was before the days of Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok etc. In recent years I finished some MOOCs, completing writing / public speaking + tech entrepreneurship certificates by HarvardX, another on leading high-performing teams by UQx (The University of Queensland) and recently, courses on cryptocurrencies / Blockchain technology by BerkeleyX.

7) I’ve many thrilling anecdotes about taxation in different countries. I hail from the UK but have lived in Germany for 4 years, Finland for 2.5 years, Singapore for over 2 years, and now back to Finland again. Please don’t ask me to file your tax return.

8) If I didn’t have a natural energy for Communications / PR / Marketing, I’ve no idea what I’d be doing as a career. Brewing beer looks like fun. 

—

Specialties: Executive Communications | Go-to-market Public Relations strategy | Media Relations | Corporate Communications | Reputation / Crisis Management | Internal Communications | Spokesperson / Speechwriting | Corporate Branding | Brand Marketing | Mobile Marketing | Content Strategy | Community Management

name: Markus Lindqvist
headline: AWS Cloud, Digital Transformation, Lean Development
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm an experienced technical lead and hands-on architect with a wide variety of technical and industry expertise in a wide range of critical projects, from embedded systems to high-traffic large-scale cloud platforms. With every industry I have worked with, I always focus on understanding the company strategy, big picture, industry specifics, and what really matters for the customers.

I enjoy working with energetic teams and I’m always looking for ways to improve the processes and ways of working.

In the consulting roles, I have worked in all the phases of successful digital project delivery: planning, building, shipping, and iterating based on customer feedback. In addition to the consultant role in implementation projects, I have also done recruitment, presales, sales, training, business development, and team-building activities.

I believe teamwork is essential when building brilliant quality products that will solve real-world customer problems. I get excited by new technologies and closely follow developments in the IT and business landscape across multiple industries. So far, I have helped with the digitalization of services in numerous industries: construction business, cyber security, streaming applications, fitness solutions, and financial industry.

name: David Maman Entrepreneur Angola
headline: managing partner on Supercell
creator: FALSE
school_1: The College of Management Academic Studies
bio:
Highly qualified, talented, tenacious, and well-accomplished professional with 20+ years’ experience armed with broad-based background and skills in the telecommunication field, as an entrepreneur, business founder, strategic planning,  business development and team building initiatives. Displays outstanding ability to plan, coordinate, implement, practices and procedures to bring significant improvements in efficiency, productivity and processes towards the successful attainment of individual and organizational growth.
Demonstrates proven effectiveness to concurrently prioritize and assume management, administrative, and technical tasks. Primarily striving to understand clients’ needs and provide them exceptional results through a cognitively flexible and positive approach. I am determined to implement earned skills and knowledge for the rapid growth of the prospective organization by working effectively and consistently with significant experience in leading and coaching individuals and teams to collaboratively implement operational structures and process that deliver on strategic objectives through good use of communication analysis.

Strong presence in Angola, active in telecommunication projects with cellular operators , distribution of cellular handsets throughout the country. Unique distributors of digital air time recharging. My passion is to empower and support individual and organizational performance beyond predictable heights by building accountability, enhanced communication and leadership skills.

name: Samuli Sorvakko
headline: Security at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm an cloud-focused architect/engineer with a background in security testing and auditing, security and IAM systems architecture and engineering with a bit of software development on the side. My programming experience is primarily in Java and C, but nowadays a variety of scripting languages is the more common tool. I'm also experienced in leading a multicultural, global team.

During my career so far, I've acquired knowledge over a wide range of public cloud and networking, security and IAM related technologies and processes, a strong knowledge of network protocols and technologies, PKI and programming languages. The multitude of standards relevant in this field (PCI, ISO27001, SOC2 etc etc) come with the territory as well.

My major technologial interests outside my current work include embedded systems, industrial control systems and networking (TCP/IP, telephone/core networks, field buses and the more obscure stuff that sometimes comes up).

name: Juho Garo Mäkinen
headline: Services at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
Juho Mäkinen is a software architect and programmer with a wide range of knowledge on complex distributed systems and high performance web services. With 18 years in the software industry, he has developed dozens of services, built and led teams and been exclusively responsible for 24/7 availability of a major ad-network.

He's an advocate for Test Driven Development and believes that new features needs to be done in small iterations with having both frontend and backend developers in the same team. Understanding, measuring delivered features with data and learning from mistakes as fast as possible is the key to build a successful product.

name: Taylor Fales
headline: Game Designer on Clash Royale
creator: FALSE
bio:
Strategy games have been my life. From a child, wanting to learn and master chess; into my teenage years when I wanted to become a Professional Starcraft Player (and came sorta close!); through to discovering my Game Designer vocation as an adult, my passion for games and strategy has been ever-present. 

I've had the greatest fortune of working at some of Vancouver's best stuios: Relic Entertainment, Blackbird Interactive, and Smoking Gun. And so it's been my great honor to work on the supreme franchises that are Company of Heroes, Dawn of War, and Age of Empires. I've had the opportunity to work on traditional AAA titles, as well as Mobile and Free-to-Play, and I genuinely love all forms and formats, as long as it's Strategy.

I'm not sure what's next, but I'm open to new projects, new places, and seeing more of the world!

My greatest assets are:
* RTS/Strategy Gameplay: Economy design, Unit/Ability design, Mechanics design, Level design 
* Analysis: Writing, Communication, Leveraging analysis for the entire team's benefit
* Mentoring: The only thing more fun than designing is sharing what I know about Design with others
* Vision Creation/Focusing: I naturally gravitate towards top-down design thinking, with 15 years experience translating that thinking into Vision and Direction
* Game Balance: my absolute favourite part of game development is post-ship product support. Collating community feedback, pro-player sentiment, and user data? Sign me up. Forever.

I believe in radical candor. I strive for excellence and expect the same from my colleagues. I know that the best creative works are collaborative ones. and love being part of a team. I do not believe in 'geniuses' derailing collaborative environments with their 'brilliance'. Respect, kindness-through-clarity, and honesty are my values and I look for them in others.

name: Aliisa Holkko
headline: Social Psychologist & Well-being Advocate
creator: TRUE
bio:
Workplace wellbeing wizard and an enthusiasm junkie on a constant learning journey ✨

My mission in life is to create happier workplaces through better human relations. I want to help individuals, groups, organizations and societies not only feel well, but really flourish! 

I'm a combination of an optimistic creativist and an efficient executor. My core strengths are enthusiasm, perspective-taking, kindness and creativity. I'm at my best when I can help other people to feel better in their work, life and relationships. 

My background is in social psychology, focusing on leadership and occupational wellbeing. In my Master's thesis, I studied software developers' experiences about appreciation at work. Before finding my passion in social psychology, I worked in the beauty business field, also as an entrepreneur. Positive psychology has strongly influenced my thinking and being, and I'm happy to share my knowledge about character strengths, work engagement, power of gratitude, or other concepts from the field. 

Currently I work at Supercell as a Health & Wellbeing Partner, being in charge of the global wellbeing strategy. My job is to make sure our people can do the best work of their careers - while being happy and healthy! 

I give talks, and train organizations about topics like workplace appreciation, feedback skills, gratitude at work, positive workplace culture, and their impact on organizational success. Some of my topics include "Strength-based feedback as a learning driver" and  "Positive communication culture as a key for team success". Please contact me if you would be interested to hear more!

bio: I started my career in 2005 and been in Games since 2012 working with multicultural and multinational companies like EA, Next Games, Rovio, Sulake, Nokia and many more. I am very creative and always bursting with new ideas. Keen learner, Good team player, and strong leadership skills. I am a highly motivated self-starter and will find my own way to do things required. I always measure the quality, considering what I would like to have as an end user. Which helps me to raise the bar for the quality. I am an innovative, curious, adaptive, equipped with can do -attitude and able to rise to the challenge. I enjoy learning new things. I´m known as hard worker who is always improving the ways of working and setting up the pilot teams.

name: Jarno Muurimäki
headline: Combat Engineer at Supercell
creator: FALSE
bio:
I'm a bass-playing & video-gaming sysadmin and a never growing up father of three.
I'm also a combat engineer, able to perform under stressful situations, limited timeframes and minimal background info on the problem at hand.

I've accumulated a couple of decades worth of experience in professional Linux/Unix administration and working with high availability live systems distributed across the planet. I possess wide-ranged knowledge and technical expertise covering all core system services, from arcane FreeBSD Hylafax servers to the leading cloud services, orchestration/IaC tools and whatever the current flavor of the month may be.

name: Marco Monteiro
headline: Clash of Clans Community Manager
creator: FALSE
bio:
Started my profissional career at 18 years old, worked in various departments, involving construction, sales, retail, events and finally, community, social media management.
With my professional background  I have developed social skills, interacting with different people, representing different companies, adapting to each individual, focusing on our mutual goals and working together to achieve something new and great. 
Passionate about traveling, I’ve lived in France, Belgium, made business trips to Finland, Estonia, Germany, meeting people from all over the world, experiencing situations that allowed me to discover and master skills such as decision-making, problem-solving, self management, languages, profissional mindset and behaviour.
